author: fwyzard
body:
#### PR description:

This PR experiments with the integration of alpaka in CMSSW, and tries to identify both the necessary changes at various levels:
  - how to organise packages and files that use alpaka;
  - how to update scram and the build rules to support building alpaka-based libraries, plugins and executables;
  - how to write alpaka-based data formats;
  - how to persist them adding minimal or no dependency on alpaka itself for reading back the files;
  - ...

The current implementation is still a draft.

#37790 will be used to keep track of the issues related to the build tools encountered while discussing this PR.

#### PR validation:

```bash
cmsRun HeterogeneousCore/AlpakaTest/test/writer.py
cmsRun HeterogeneousCore/AlpakaTest/test/reader.py
```
run successfully, both _with_ and _without_ a GPU, using a `SwitchProducerCUDA` to choose the modules to run.

In both cases, the `test.root` file created by the `writer.py` configuration contains the same collections:
```bash
$ edmDumpEventContent --all test.root 
Type                                  Module                 Label     Process         Full Name
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
PortableHostCollection<portabletest::TestSoA>    "testProducer"         ""        "Writer"        portabletestTestSoAPortableHostCollection_testProducer__Writer
PortableHostCollection<portabletest::TestSoA>    "testProducerSerial"   ""        "Writer"        portabletestTestSoAPortableHostCollection_testProducerSerial__Writer
```

#### Open issues

Pointed out by @makortel:
  - [x] rename the `XyzId` package to e.g. `PortableTestObjects`, and move all objects there in the _e.g._ `portabletest` (or `edmtest`, `cms::test`, or some other `*test`) namespace
    - [ ] should we rename the `AlpakaTest` package to `PortableTest` ?
  - [x] something should be done for the `host` variable in global scope (the name feels too generic). Could it be placed _e.g._ in `alpaka_common` namespace?
    - [x] @fwyzard: it should probably be moved to be a static variable in some kind of `getHost()` function
    - [ ] for the time being I've settled on `alpaka_common::host()` 
  - [x] replace the use of `std::cout` with the `MessageLogger`
  - [ ] address `const` correctness with Alpaka buffers (see https://github.com/cms-sw/cmssw/pull/37716#discussion_r888152966 and https://github.com/alpaka-group/alpaka/issues/1729)
  - [ ] review the use of `beginStream()` and `endStream()`, because they can be called under unexpected conditions (see https://github.com/cms-sw/cmssw/pull/37716#discussion_r888254868)

Ongoing work by @ericcano and @fwyzard:
  - [x] make the `XyzId` structures match the macro-generated ones for a corresponding SoA
  - [ ] add the `view` and `const_view` and pass those to the kernels

---
Edit: currently the file content actually look like
```
Type                                  Module                 Label     Process         Full Name
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
PortableHostCollection<portabletest::TestSoALayoutT<128,false> >    "testProducer"         ""        "Writer"        128falseportabletestTestSoALayoutTPortableHostCollection_testProducer__Writer
PortableHostCollection<portabletest::TestSoALayoutT<128,false> >    "testProducerSerial"   ""        "Writer"        128falseportabletestTestSoALayoutTPortableHostCollection_testProducerSerial__Writer
```
but this may change as we improve the definition of the SoA templates and views.
title: Test alpaka integration in CMSSW
